title: Stars Shine at the Brits Awards Red Carpet
summary: The Brits Awards is a big music event in the UK. This year, it was held in Manchester for the first time instead of London. Many famous singers and stars walked on the red carpet, showing off their fancy clothes. Olivia Dean wore a yellow dress and won awards for album and artist of the year. Harry Styles wore a pinstripe suit and performed after three years. Other stars like Maya Jama and Rosé also looked beautiful and won awards. The red carpet was full of colorful and stylish outfits, making it a fun night for music fans.

background_read: The Brits Awards is an annual music awards ceremony in the United Kingdom that celebrates the best in British and international music. It started in 1977 and is known for its live performances and celebrity appearances. The red carpet is a tradition where stars arrive in fancy outfits, and it's often televised for fans to watch. This year, the event moved to Manchester's Co-op Live Arena, marking a change from its usual location in London. Awards like album of the year and artist of the year are given to top musicians.
Article_Structure: WHO: Famous singers and stars like Olivia Dean, Harry Styles, Maya Jama, and Rosé.
WHAT: They attended the Brits Awards red carpet, showed their fashion, and some won awards.
WHERE: In Manchester at the Co-op Live Arena, not London.
WHY: To celebrate music, perform, and enjoy a fun night with stylish outfits.
